intro: Solidago asterifolia, commonly known as the slender goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as meadows, swamps, and stream banks. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
